intro: Dubyaea grandis, commonly known as the large dubyaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to poor soil conditions and high temperatures. Dubyaea grandis is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and resilience.
